Great news on the decoupler. Is it a plugin? If so could it be used to make fairings that act properly?

Yeah it\'s a plugin, a real simple one.

However, adapting it for general use would be tricky - it works by finding all parts attached to it. In case of Hope, there is a special cargo hold node the decoupler attaches to, and all cargo practically must be attached to it.

In a normal stack this would be more difficult - parts would actually be on top of it, not its children. And the fairings would have to be separate parts. This is all possible from programmers point of view, but there is MUCH greater freedom when it comes to normal fairings, so a general solution would be much more abusable - and more difficult to program to work reliably.

However, I thought about it a little, and I think an elegant solution is possible. Will try to work on it and maybe release it as a standalone plugin.

Probably it\'s time to do an STS style launcher

Great work man! Makes me exceptionally angry that I can\'t actually play KSP now. I definitely plan to implement the cargo doors into a future version of the CSS shuttle.

Ok, so I\'ve tested a \'satellite recovery\' mission - the shuttle bay has lots of colliders so a decent sized cargo will stay inside of the bay once caught.

It usually peeks out a little - so it\'s not very pretty, but is doable if someone really wants it.

Larger problem is that collision detection is disabled when ship goes on rails - so if you hit higher warp than 2x, the cargo will slowly drift through the shuttle.
